title: About Naijá Na Helele
introduction: Naijá Na Helele is dedicated to the celebration, preservation, and advancement of Nigerian Pidgin as a vibrant force in culture and communication.
mission: To harness the growth of Naijá (Nigerian Pidgin) as a powerful lingua franca that connects millions across Nigeria and the global diaspora. We aim to create platforms for collaboration, research, education, and cultural expression.
vision: We envision a world where Naijá is recognized and respected as a vital language of culture, commerce, and communication. A language that carries the stories, wisdom, and aspirations of over 100 million speakers.
history: Nigerian Pidgin, known locally as Naijá, is an English-based creole language spoken as a lingua franca across Nigeria and in Nigerian diaspora communities worldwide. With an estimated 75-100 million speakers, it serves as the most widely spoken language in Nigeria, transcending ethnic and regional boundaries.
